apps.linear.simulation
Class Simulator

java.lang.Object
  apps.linear.simulation.Simulator

public class Simulator
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements a registration simulator, in which students queue up at a registration window to register for classes. Each student is labeled with the time of the student's arrival in the registration queue. The simulation can be run in a sequence of slices, and the status can be observed at the end of every slice.

Author:
Sesh Venugopal

          The clock that keeps time for current simulation slice.

(package private)  int intervalRegistered
          Number of students who registered in current slice of simulation.
(package private)  int intervalWaitTime
          Time spent in queue by all students who registered in current slice of simulation.
(package private)  int numStudents
          Number of students who arrived to register since the start of the simulation.
(package private)  int registered
          Number of students who have been registered for the duration of the simulation.
(package private)  StudentSource source
          Source that simulates student arrivals.
(package private)  Queue<java.lang.Integer> studentQ
          Queue of students, in which each student is labeled with the time of the student's arrival.
(package private)  int waitTime
          Total time spent in queue by all students who registered since start of simulation.
(package private)  Register window
          Registration window simulator.

studentQ

Queue<java.lang.Integer> studentQ
Queue of students, in which each student is labeled with the time of the student's arrival. The queue is maintained in a generic Queue instantiated with the Integer type.

Method Detail

init

public void init(float probOfArrival,
                 int timeToRegister)
Primes this simulator with a probability of arrival of students, and a registration time.

Parameters:
probOfArrival - Probability of arrival of a student in the next time interval.
timeToRegister - Time required to register a student.

run

public void run(int howLong)
Runs the simulation for a given time interval of interest, and then pauses the simulation for examination of status.

Parameters:
howLong - Time interval for which simulation should be run.

printStatus

public void printStatus(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Prints the status of the simulator including various statistics.

Parameters:
pw - PrintWriter used to print status.

printSnapshot

public void printSnapshot(java.io.PrintWriter pw)
Prints a snapshot of the simulation showing students in the queue (if any), student at the registration window (if any), regisration clock, and simulation clock.

Parameters:
pw - PrintWriter used to print snapshot.
